TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TableLayoutStyleCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Collections.IList

Docs.summary: Implements the basic functionality for a collection of table layout styles.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TableLayoutStyleCollection class represents the collection of all the styles used to describe the columns or rows in an associated <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel>. Classes derived from TableLayoutStyleCollection are specialized as follows:
- A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutColumnStyleCollection> aggregates column styles as a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnStyle> objects.
- A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutRowStyleCollection> aggregates row styles as a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle> objects.
Most of the members of TableLayoutStyleCollection are implementations of <xref:System.Collections.IList>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 Add(class System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle style) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a new to the end of the current collection.
Docs.returns: The position into which the new element was inserted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Add method reapplies the table layout to all the controls in the current <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> container.
The number of styles stored in a collection is limited only by available memory.

Docs.exception: is already assigned to another owner. You must first remove it from its current location or clone it.
Docs.value: The position into which the new element was inserted.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Disassociates the collection from its associated and empties the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method cannot be overridden.
The Clear method performs two main actions:
- It disassociates the current <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyleCollection> from its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> container so that the styles are no longer applied to the layout of the controls contained within the panel. As a result, the table layout is reapplied to all the controls in the panel.
- It empties the collection of all of its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle> objects. As a result, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyleCollection.Count%2A> property is set to 0.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of styles actually contained in the .
Docs.value: The number of styles actually contained in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The number of styles stored in a collection is limited only by available memory.

Docs.returns: The number of styles actually contained in the .

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle this[int index] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the to get or set.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets at the specified index.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Only one of the derived <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle> types, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnStyle> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.RowStyle>, can be stored in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyleCollection>.
An instance of a style can be associated only with a single container.

Docs.exception: The property value is already assigned to another owner. You must first remove it from its current location or clone it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes the style at the specified index of the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method cannot be overridden.
Before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutStyle> is removed, it is disassociated from its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TableLayoutPanel> container. As a result, the table layout is reapplied to all the controls in the panel.
